Author: Erika Kapu
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Dear all, I'm Erika and I've been appointed by KAPU as Investor Relations Manager. I see there are concerns about the project and its development, so I will be more happy to answer your questions and resolve your doubts. I will try my best in order to give you concrete answers.  In the meanwhile, I can assure that the KAPU team is doing its best to improve the project - both in term of development and networking. Today we launched - on Google Play - the new version of kapu-mobile (kapu-mobile 1.1.3: bugfixing release - merge with ark-mobile 1.1.2 - Fix QR code - Fix keypad delay - minor fixes)  In addition, here you can find the reports about the events we recently took part in: - https://medium.com/@kapucoin/report-project-held-by-the-municipality-of-naples-italy-66b4cd032e68 - https://medium.com/kapucoin/report-legal-hackers-pompei-97eae45d6963  About the first one, as you can read, KAPU has joined the working group wanted by the Municipality of Naples in order to develop and implement objectives related to the blockchain. About the second event, our team has been invited to take part in the meeting organized by Legal Hackers Naples, in order to present the KAPU Project. Lawyers, academics and journalists paid close attention not only to our goals, but also to the innovative DpoS system - adopted by the cryptocoin Kapu and used in place of the traditional POW system.  Lot of great news are coming as well, we will keep you update.

Author: Zebedee23
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Responsible Disclosure Announcement  On August 13th, 2018 I discovered an issue with the KAPU blockchain:  - All database entries in the votes table got duplicated on July 17th. - The KAPU team had distributed a corrupted snapshot (with the duplicated database entries) to all nodes and doing so corrupted their blockchain. - ARK delegate Goose informed KAPU of the duplicate vote issue because it broke his payscript. This took place on the moment the problem occured and KAPU failed to recognize the severity nor did they act to analyse and find a solution.  Currently the KAPU blockchain is corrupted:  - It can't be restored from 0 - It can't be upgraded to ARK v2 - A number of forging delegates is only elected due to the duplicated votes, receiving and distributing KAPU tokens that they shouldn't  There are 2 possible solutions:  1. Revert to the blockchain as per July 17th (and lose all transactions since) 2. Restart a new blockchain and distribute tokens to reflect the current balances (and lose all history)  The KAPU team has been informed of the problem on July 26th and August 13th. We have been working closely with their dev team to analyse the problem and this has lead to a security update on ARK Node v1 (v1.1.0). KAPU team however has a responsibility to their users to take a decision how to proceed and how to compensate their token owners. Up until today KAPU failed to inform their tokenholders and take measures to secure the integrity of their blockchain.  @Marc - cryptology , ARK Slack  https://steemit.com/arkecosystem/@jarunik/kapu-disclosure-announcement

Author: ellieg
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: I am not really sure what you mean when you say: "because the area that the project pursues is not much interest".  I think most of the people that have been following this project have a romantic view of what archaeology and heritage is and look for an immediate source of income. For this to be successful and sustainable in the long run, we need to engage with archaeologists and the relevant stakeholders from the beginning, which is what we are currently doing. This means the project is running slowly, if compared to other current coins, but is creating a solid network of professionals in academia and outside that are interested and can help to develop a product that will be used. Now, as investor in this project, I do understand the frustration of the community as the price keeps dropping, but as archaeologist this is the right way to develop a final and useful product.

Author: ellieg
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: We have presented at a specialist conference in Germany at the end of last month and received good feedback from colleagues in archaeology. we are in contact with a couple of colleagues interested in the project and in helping to develop the database. So there is interest in the project and we are looking on how we can integrate expertise to continue the development.

Author: kiashaan
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Hey guys, some news for you all! There will be a more official announcement about this at some point, but I know everyone is interested in hearing updates ASAP. We will be presenting Kapu at the 2018 CAA (computer applications and quantitative methods in archaeology) international conference in Turbingen. - http://2018.caaconference.org/. The exact schedule hasn't been published yet but we will be presenting at some time between the 19th-23rd March. We also are in discussion with people who will hopefully come on board to help with comms as part of the team and we hope to introduce them in the coming weeks. The team had a meeting last night and aside from the obvious (exchange listing) there are no major issues and work is going forward on DIANA by @gsilvestri.  Arigard.

Author: rtom1990
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Hello fellow Kapuans, Richard and Goose consider ourselves new to the crypto world, however we have both embraced it whole hearted in the past 6 months and havenâ€™t looked back. Goose has been tinkering with computers ever since I was given a Commodore 64 to play with at a very young age. Goose is currently in the financial service sector as a risk management specialist. Richard has come from a different field being in that of mechanical engineering & estimating industry, where risk and calculated costs are always taken into account as well of profits within the area. We are both very excited about KAPU and think the archeological twist is a great one. We are proposing running 2 delegates (1-off private, 1-off public). We believe in rewarding those that are within our pool, we want to create a community within the pool where those that do vote for us can approach us if they have any queries as we look to improve the culture as a whole for those new to the DPoS world. You can reach either of us on slack @goose or @riichard if you have any questions about our proposal OUR PROPOSAL We are proposing running 2 delegate nodes as follows:  Goose (private delegate)  -   For high balance wallets (>15k) -   Weekly payout (until script automation then daily) -   Initial 20% share rate which will go up as KAPU price does -   Looking for 2-25 voters (>25 go on waitlist) to maintain good dilution rate -   Initial fidelity of 7 days to prevent pool hopping (will reduce to 24 hours after daily distributions start) -   No min/max payment, tx fees covered  Duck (public delegate)  -   All wallets welcome especially small ones -   Weekly payout -   Fidelity of 7 days to prevent pool hopping -   Initial 20% share rate which will go up as KAPU price does -   Will only distribute rewards to wallets up to 15K (over 15k only get rewards on 15k balance) to be fair to small wallets -   No min payment, tx fees covered In addition, we will be reserving 2.5% of forged rewards from each delegate (5% collectively) and are planning to build a KAPU faucet to spread the KAPU love far and wide both within and outside the community to get the word out. It is currently in process of being developed but we hope to make ~42 KAPU a day available for anyone that wants KAPU. Other Details: NETWORK SETUP We plan to run 3 nodes (2 mainnet, 1 devnet). Note: We plan to upgrade as needed to meet the needs of the network Goose Node Host: Vultr CPU: 2 vCore RAM: 4GB DISK: - 60GB Duck Node Host: Vultr CPU: 2 vCore RAM: 4GB DISK: - 60GB Back-up for goose/duck - Vultr â€“ as needed Devnet Node Host: Personal CPU: 4 core RAM: 8GB DISK: 120GB CONCLUSION Thanks for reading â€“ vote for us if you can!

We believe in rewarding those that are within our pool, we want to create a community within the pool where those that do vote for us can approach us if they have any queries as we look to improve the culture as a whole for those new to the DPoS world. You can reach either of us on slack @goose or @riichard if you have any questions about our proposal OUR PROPOSAL We are proposing running 2 delegate nodes as follows:  Goose (private delegate)  -   For high balance wallets (>15k) -   Weekly payout (until script automation then daily) -   Initial 20% share rate which will go up as KAPU price does -   Looking for 2-25 voters (>25 go on waitlist) to maintain good dilution rate -   Initial fidelity of 7 days to prevent pool hopping (will reduce to 24 hours after daily distributions start) -   No min/max payment, tx fees covered  Duck (public delegate)  -   All wallets welcome especially small ones -   Weekly payout -   Fidelity of 7 days to prevent pool hopping -   Initial 20% share rate which will go up as KAPU price does -   Will only distribute rewards to wallets up to 15K (over 15k only get rewards on 15k balance) to be fair to small wallets -   No min payment, tx fees covered In addition, we will be reserving 2.5% of forged rewards from each delegate (5% collectively) and are planning to build a KAPU faucet to spread the KAPU love far and wide both within and outside the community to get the word out. It is currently in process of being developed but we hope to make ~42 KAPU a day available for anyone that wants KAPU. Other Details: NETWORK SETUP We plan to run 3 nodes (2 mainnet, 1 devnet). Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: After weeks of contacting exchanges we think it's time to throw in some weight. Why don't we all apply for listing at let's say Poloniex?  To create maximum effect, let's coordinate this to submit the form on the same day, Sunday, October 21, 2017. The link to the coin request form: https://poloniex.com/coinRequest  Data to use: - What is the name of the coin? Kapucoin - What is the coin's symbol? KAPU "Êž" - Please link to the announcement page: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2035561.0 - If the coin has a website, please link it here: https://kapu.one - If the coin has a block explorer, please link it here: https://explorer.kapu.one - Please explain why you would like to see this coin added to the exchange: Needs to be in your own words.. - If this coin has any significant innovations over other coins, please elaborate on them here: example : Kapu is a platform that aims to preserve the finds all around the world using the Blockchain technology! All of this will be possible by developing a decentralized global index that will be free for universities and ministries. A peculiarity that characterize this project is the Blockchain evolution through the latest innovations (ex. 3D's file of the artifact, 3D visors, etc...).  We know we can count on your help. Thanks!

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Practical applications of blockchain for archaeology is that data is archived in libraries and services such as the Archaeology Data Service (ADS). Blockchain could offer an immutable record for archives.

Author: Vorteqs
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Yes, being the first project of its kind with the aim of storing archaeological data on blockchain, it's got a huge investment potential

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Kapu would be especially useful for museums who could store their artifact catalog with blockchain privately, but provide different levels of access to staff, researchers, and the public. If a museum were to be looted, it could release data using hash codes to law enforcement to prevent export or sale of artifacts of matching descriptions.

Author: JooBra
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: I also think it would connect more museums to each other. It would help them to exchange knowledge safe and fast without any type of risks. That's only one of possibilities for this project, there are so many other. This is such a good and interesting project.

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Another big plus to this project is the use of the DPoS system to record archeological findings and timestamped as well as run the entire network. This system doesn't require the whole network to validate a transaction as the traditional proof-of-stake (POS) model. Instead, the model only requires a small number of delegates to validate a transaction. With 51 original delegates in the KAPU network which will be elected through a decentralized voting mechanism, they will be responsible for validating transactions and maintaining the blockchain. In case one of the delegates goes rogue or stops performing their job, the votes may be revoked and a new delegate is elected by the network.

Author: Vorteqs
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: I also read that the DPoS model is democratic and has several advantages, being more energy efficient and having higher incentives for development which is good for the Kapu project.

Author: wolfgb888
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: the Ico is continuing very well, you can follow him from the chat of telegram. This month the worldâ€™s first â€œarchaeology coinâ€ launched to fanfare from a small community; however, it might be part of a coming social science data revolution. Named Kapu, the digital currency is similar to Bitcoin, but specifically designed for archaeology. The technology underlying Kapu and Bitcoin is called blockchain and it may change data storage and cultural heritage protection. While the public is unaccustomed with blockchain, there is good reason to believe we may be witnessing the first step in what will become a standard technology over the next decade.

The technique of data notarization aims to exploit the security principles and immutability provided natively by the public blockchain to purpose to respond more effectively to the regulations required in Europe and America. To solve this problem the logic of blockchain with the open timestamps can guarantee independence from any third party provider as well as providing high tight security."

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Yes exactly, to add to this, it runs on a DPOS system, i.e a delegate proof of stake. The main difference is that you don't need to use energy to mine the Kapucoin. Other differences is that POS involves the participation of the entire network to validate a transaction whereas DPOS involves only a limit number of delegates.These delegates perform the function of validating transactions, maintaining the blockchain and take the transaction fees as profit.

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: First apply for delegate position,  if you are selected, find the reward below: Every day 10,800 blocks are forged by 51 active delegates. one active delegate proceeds on average 211 blocks each day and forge on average (it could be a bit more or a bit â€˜less depending on the missed blocks and the average block time): That's 422 KAPUs every day, 12.800 KAPUs each month, 154.030 KAPUs every year. 51 active delegates will forge about 7,747,920 KAPUs every year. The reward of 2 KAPU will be maintained for the foreseeable future. Unlike some other blocks, KAPU will not reduce forging prizes every year or simplify the size of a given block, but because of the same prize, inflation will drop each year.

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Delegated Proof of Stake is a method for securing a cryptocurrency network, processing transactions and achieving a distributed consensus regarding the ownership of funds without the need for a central authority. It is a variant of the Proof of Stake system, which itself was developed in order to reduce the cost and inefficient electricity usage associated with Proof of Work systems such as the one used by Bitcoin. The DPOS method, developed by Daniel Larimer and implemented for the first time by the Bitshares blockchain, diverge from the POS system. The difference between a POS system and a DPOS system is that POS involves the participation of the entire network to validate a transaction whereas DPOS involves only a limit number of delegates. These delegates perform the function of validating transactions, maintaining the blockchain and take the transaction fees as profit.

Author: enigmatical
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Delegated Proof of Stake (DPOS) is the fastest, most efficient, most decentralized, and most flexible consensus model available. DPOS leverages the power of stakeholder approval voting to resolve consensus issues in a fair and democratic way unlike Proof of Stakeholder (POS) which incentivizes large coin holders to stake their balance, yet it is not necessarily beneficial to smaller coin holders. Since the staking rewards are based on network â€œweightâ€, anyone with a small balance will often see less â€œstake rewardsâ€ compared to those with much larger holdings. It is not necessarily the fairest way of distributing staking rewards by any means. So in conclusion the DPOS is a better model which this project would employ. The DPOS cryptocurrencies such as LISK, Shift, ARK, RISE can be used in participating in this crowd funding.

Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: A reminder of useful links and a brief summary of what the project is trying to achieve  Invite link to Telegram: https://t.me/joinchat/AAAAAEO9aD3Zve2u0uxbsg  Pre-sale and ICO chat: https://t.me/kapu_pre_sale  Invite link to Slack: http://slack.kapu.one  Blockchain Explorer: http://explorer.kapu.one  GitHub: https://github.com/kapucoin/kapu-node  Whitepaper: https://kapu.one/WP_EN.pdf  Website: http://kapu.one  Forum: http://forum.kapu.one  Bitcointalk thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2035561.0  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kapucoin  Twitter: https://twitter.com/kapucoin  Forging and Wallet guide:  https://pastebin.com/1WueQRrs   * Timeline: * At the moment we have built the KAPU's network which is an ARK fork and we have launched a pre-sale, this is the link: https://t.me/kapu_pre_sale The integration of the functionalities indicates on the WhitePaper is scheduled for 2018 and will be developed by one of the best skilled Italian team.  * Sponsor: * ARK Team  * Goal: * The ultimated goal of this project is to preserve the artifacts all around the world using the Blockchain technology! All of this will be possible by developing a decentralized global index that will be free for universities and ministries. A peculiarity that will characterize this project will be the Blockchain evolution through the latest innovations. (ex. 3D's file of the artifact, 3D visors, etc.).

Author: wolfgb888
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: The Capua is a city of Rome  and it is the coin used in Rome. Coins were forged with all three metals (bronze, silver, gold), but Capua was the only one of the three cities to issue precious metal coins. Blockchain is most secured technology which was used in KAPU. By using blockchain people can send their precious data safely and quickly without taking any middleman help. KAPU can send arhceological data with any institute or government body  and with anyone in a safe way.

Author: wolfgb888
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: The Blockchain is not only criptovaluta. The coins of the virtual is, in fact, only one of its countless possible applications. And it is precisely thanks to the absence of a centralized management that is the Blockchain allows you to send any data in a secure manner, in the absence of intermediaries and allowing an exchange of data is free from risks between the two entity. And it is precisely this intrinsic safety, which, with its characteristic of the immutability excludes the need of having to resort to means of third parties, such as, for example, an e-mail provider, a service cloud computing, or external certification, or systems the timestamp for a certain date

Author: wolfgb888
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: The Capua is a city of Rome  and it is the coin used in Rome. Coins were forged with all three metals (bronze, silver, gold), but Capua was the only one of the three cities to issue precious metal coins. Blockchain is most secured technology which was used in KAPU. By using blockchain people can send their precious data safely and quickly without taking any middleman help. KAPU can send arhceological data with any institute or government body  and with anyone in a safe way.

Body: Kapu Facebook Campaign  140000 Kapu of the bounty pool will be allocated to the Facebook campaign.  Terms:  Â· Each member of Facebook Bounty campaign should have at least 300 friends Â· In order to participate, each member should go through registration Â· Then, each member should follow official Kapu page FACEBOOK LINK, like and follow the Kapu page, and re-post at least one Kapu post per week. Â· The bounty campaign timing is till the end of ICO. In order to receive the bonus, each member is expected to participate till the end of the campaign. Â· A member, who has not hit Like, or has not shared posts during one week, or unfollowed Kapu official page is not eligible for a reward. The list of participants is being updated and analyzed once per week. Each accepted campaign member is to receive 1 share per week.  After ICO is finished, the whole Kapu bounty pool is to be redistributed among all campaign members considering the number of shares each member has. All members are to receive the reward to their wallets. Author: jamiec79
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Not scam.  Just because someone's first language isn't English you call scam??  The project is a fork from ark, the first to successfully launch a testnet from ark fork. If you look at all DPOS coins they all originated from bitshare/crypti, then lisk, shift and ark. The point of DPOS is it's open source. So people share ideas.  If you look at the delegate list on testnet you will notice a number of ark team members supporting kapu by setting up testnet nodes.  It's well supported and imo has a great idea.  If you have any questions I'm sure we can answer, but baseless accusations will not be accepted.  Thanks  Jamiec79

Author: kapucoin
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Taken from the KAPU whitepaper at this address: https://kapu.one/WP_EN.pdf  How it works Purposes, DPOS and chain explanation, coin etc. Delegated Proof of Stake is a method for securing a cryptocurrency network, processing transactions and achieving a distributed consensus regarding the ownership of funds without the need for a central authority. It is a variant of the Proof of Stake system, which itself was developed in order to reduce the cost and inefficient electricity usage associated with Proof of Work systems such as the one used by Bitcoin. The DPOS method, developed by Daniel Larimer and implemented for the first time by the Bitshares blockchain, diverge from the POS system. The difference between a POS system and a DPOS system is that POS involves the participation of the entire network to validate a transaction whereas DPOS involves only a limit number of delegates. These delegates perform the function of validating transactions, maintaining the blockchain and take the transaction fees as profit. KAPU Whitepaper VI Within this transaction validation system, each delegate receives a reward in KAPU token, in the form of transaction fee, in order to cover the operating costs needed to keep in efficiency conditions forgetting nodes (to which transaction verification is delegated) as well as maintaining the KAPU network in safe conditions. If delegates should conduct their job incorrectly or take advantage of their own authority, the votes may be revoked by voters and assigned to a new delegate. This system can guarantee the security of the network within a representative democratic logic. Unlike other DPOS systems, the KAPU network is composed of 51 delegates. The decision to assign the transaction validation to only 51 delegates was taken in order to allow us to guarantee a fast, efficient and stable network with an incredible time limit of 8 seconds per block. The KAPU DPOS based system is essential, safe and also compatible with energy saving. The KAPU project is also inspired by some innovators in this field like LISK, SHIFT, ARK in order to create the first archaeological blockchain and to gather information about history, finds, ancient artefacts and finally make them usable by the entire community.  I hope that ghost information is clear to me to understand how DPOS works.  Team KAPU

Author: ghostfaceuk
Title: [ANN] KAPU - The first Archaeological Blockchain -
Body: Hi traspy,  I see you are calling this a scam.  can I ask have you actually looked at this project than just what is on the thread?  yes the dev's grasp of english is not the best but thats becuase he is Italian.   The Kapu coin is a fork of Ark, the dev Kiashaan is actually getting help from the Ark team to set up and make sure everything is ok ready for launch.  testnet is running is you would like to take a closer look.  The coin has been in development for months, if you had been on the ark slack testnet channel for the last few months you would have seen Kiashaan asking the Ark main dev Fixcrypt for help to set up the token.  I am not a dev/part of the team of Kapu.  I am however a member of the testnet for the coin and I think it has a future in the crypto world.

Terms:  Â· Each member of Facebook Bounty campaign should have at least 300 friends Â· In order to participate, each member should go through registration Â· Then, each member should follow official Kapu page FACEBOOK LINK, like and follow the Kapu page, and re-post at least one Kapu post per week. Â· The bounty campaign timing is till the end of ICO. In order to receive the bonus, each member is expected to participate till the end of the campaign. Â· A member, who has not hit Like, or has not shared posts during one week, or unfollowed Kapu official page is not eligible for a reward. The list of participants is being updated and analyzed once per week. Each accepted campaign member is to receive 1 share per week.  After ICO is finished, the whole Kapu bounty pool is to be redistributed among all campaign members considering the number of shares each member has. All members are to receive the reward to their wallets. Kapu signature codes are available here: https://pastebin.com/JT8bmW1H Â· Each campaign member should make at least 50 publications on Bitcointalk outside Kapu topic page https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2035561.20  during their participation in campaign.
